open_risks: Policy shock: Trump tariff escalation vs Canada (and broader trade spillover) reignites inflation-risk premium and risk-off simultaneously (worst case: equities down while yields up).
US government funding/shutdown brinkmanship into the Jan 30 deadline creates headline gap risk and safe-haven flows; could distort USD/gold correlations.

FOMC communication risk: a ‘hawkish hold’ tone after firm activity data lifts real yields and pressures Nasdaq-duration; alternatively a dovish surprise can reflate duration but may amplify USD/gold volatility.
Mega-cap earnings/guidance concentration: index moves dominated by a few names; NQ vs ES divergence and post-close gap risk.
Europe growth softness becomes a broader global-growth catalyst (Ifo miss as an early hint); could reinforce defensive factor moves if PMIs confirm.
